comment: ALL ‼️ bad ratings below are from online takers. Dr. Pammy is the MOST excellent professor that the CM department has to offer. She is helpful and wants all students to succeed. If you gain nothing from the class, it's on you bc she sets students up for success. I wish I would've taken her in the fall to have a full semester instead of summer.

This class is very dependent on actually showing up and asking questions. Professor Parminder encourages everyone to ask questions in class to start a group discussion. The class is not hard, just pay attention. Definitely not a "free grade" type of class.

Do not take the online class. It is a waste of time. You will have random assignments posted throughout the semester with no warning and 3+ hour long lecture videos from over two years ago. She will grade very harshly and not ever explain why you got the question wrong. The class group chat is constantly posting how everyone is struggling.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Parminder Juneja is a very tough grader who does not provide good feedback at all. Class is unnecessarily hard. She posts video recorded lectures from her in-person classes that are very long and does not post the notes from these lectures either.

From the looks of it she hasn't had much experience in the real world. Only talks about her time in GA tech and compares it to everything. Its not the best that she is the only one who can teach this class. I am taking her now and most of the students in my class are repeats. She doesn't communicate and she doesn't help military students at all.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: No response to emails, no clear feedback on assignments, no extra credit. Uses outdated teaching methods and lacks efficiency. Overall, the worst professor I have ever had.

I loved Dr Pammy. One of the most caring professors Ive had. She seems strict and scary, but is one of the funniest and caring persons. Make sure you take good notes. Good notes= a good grade. 90% of the class is tests but she basically gives you everything to get an A. 10 percent is homeowrks. Highly reccommend.

Dr. Pammy is the best professor I've taken in all of college without exaggeration. At first I thought I would struggle in this class because I thought she'd be strict, boring class, and course would be unnecessarily difficult. The course is challenging but as long as you pay attention and take good notes it's not that difficult. Take it in-person!

Do not take her online class, it is more difficult. Assignments and tests are open note, but the material is difficult regardless. Assignments were assigned randomly throughout the semester. Class test and quiz averages were always low, but she was at least accommodating at the end of the semester with final grades.

She takes attendance but posts the recorded lectures from the week every Friday, so if you miss a day it's easy to catch up. All the test and everything is open notes, so you have to write down everything she does. If you have detailed notes, the tests are pretty straightforward. She loves to add extra info to problems to trip you up.

If you rated this professor poorly, you did not focus. She is so sweet and very knowledgeable. She gives most of her quiz answers away in lectures so by writing down everything you will do great. The concepts are quite easy to grab and Excel is a good friend here, however you can not use it on tests. She is tough love and I actually learned.

Where to begin?! I took this class online due to covid. She was terrible! her test average for the class was 60%. She makes you buy the book then complains about it not being correct. Each test is about 3 chapters but the test consists of only 2 math problems and complicated fill in the blank questions. DONT TAKE HER CLASS ONLINE!

I would highly recommend NOT taking her class online. Due to coronavirus, unfortunately, some of us have too. She makes you buy the book but then tells you not to use it for 75% of class. Attendance is mandatory and she wont work with you on most situations some students are faceing. I would NOT take this teacher if u have another choice.

Takes her job seriously. You will either learn the course content or repeat the class. She is extremely knowledgeable, fun-natured but focused, and is one of the best professors in the Construction Management department. Pick a good group for the project, or prepare to do all the work yourself. Take thorough notes during lectures to pass the tests.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects
